passages.text: USA | Interactive Entertainment
[Watch the Video] Roblox Expert Recap:Bringing Brands Onboard

We hosted Charles Hambo, CEO and Co-Founder of GEEIQ, to discuss the evolution of brand integrations on RBLX. GEEIQ has tracked 1,050 brand activations in RBLX, shifting from brands building bespoke experiences, to buying branded integrations within existing hits. Brand budgets have grown from innovation spend to traditional marketing budgets, often part of broader campaigns as brands see spending on RBLX similar to social channels. Replay Here.

**Roblox IP Platform:** Mr. Hambro believes RBLX is modeling its new IP platform similar to social media and YouTube. Much of the IP related content on RBLX is unofficial, with RBLX giving brands better tools to identify and manage the use of their IP. Like with YouTube and others, brands may decide even unofficial content is positive for engagement with their brand, but when they do want to take action, the IP platform lets them do so. It also gives a more formal avenue for brands to identify and chose developers to partner with. The license fees are bespoke negotiations, not a standard rate, but are likely in the ~15% range. He believes these efforts legitimize RBLX as a more serious media and engagement platform. It's still in the testing phase, but brands are already starting to use it.

**Barriers to Entry for Brands are Lower:** GEEIQ is a data provider to give brands intelligence and consulting services as they integrate into virtual worlds. GEEIQ has tracked over 1,050 brand activations on RBLX since 2022, and another 564 on Fortnite. The first activations were brands working with RBLX developers to build bespoke experiences for their brands, the cost could range from $1M-$2M, and be very hit or miss given the quality of the experience itself. Since the cost to create a branded experience has come down to ~$200k due to competition among devs and better dev tools including AI.

**Shifting from Experiences to Integrations:** The way brands are engaging with RBLX is evolving.While many brands still hire dev to create bespoke RBLX experiences for their brand, many are choosing to instead buy branded integrations within existing popular experiences. These can range from entire themed updates, to just some branded items, but moves branding in RBLX more similar to existing social channels. Most bullishly, Mr. Hambro is seeing brands shift RBLX spend from their innovation budget to their always-on marketing and social media departments, with localized teams increasingly giving decisions. This places RBLX closer to the media alongside TV, ping,and social media often part of broader campaigns. Separately, he said GEEIQ has not seen a large reaction from brands to the recent child safety headlines.

**Speaker Bio: Charles Hambro** is CEO and Co-Founder of GEEIQ, a data platform and insights provider that empowers brands such as Walmart, L'Oréal, Gucci, and even Elton John, to create long-term strategies and data-led investments in gaming and virtual worlds. In September 2023,Charles was named one of Vogue Business'100 Innovators.

Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 4-9 of this report. * Jefferies LLC / Jefferies Research Services, LLC
Equity ResearchAugust 28,2025

**Ed Alter*|Equity Associate**

Roblox has developed into one of the largest platforms for user- generated gaming content for the 8- 13- year- old demographic. We expect the company to remain among the fastest- growing platforms within gaming and consumer Internet, as international expansion, aging up of the user base, and improving monetization drive sustainable \(20\%\) - bookings growth. However, we remain skeptical about whether the company can build a meaningful advertising business and achieve high long- term margins. We are Hold rated on the stock.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

- DAUs grow at a \(15\%\) CAGR through 2029. Aging up happens slowly through retention of current users- Spend per hour of engagement increases low-single-digits as monetization per player improves.- Bookings through 2027 grow \(20\% +\) off of a re-rated 2025.- Advertising not material in the near-term.- Our \(\) 126\(PT implies 45x 2026E EBITDA of\) \ \(1.86B\)

- The aging-up initiative is successful quicker than we anticipate as RBLX is able to market its platform to gamers over 16. Bookings through 2027 grow \(25\% +\), aided by increased spend per user.- International expansion accelerates, driving the DAU 5-year CAGR \(15\% +\)- Advertising roll-out creates an incremental revenue stream for RBLX.- Our \(\) 150\(PT implies 50x 2026E EBITDA of\) \ \(2.0B\)

- Lack of engagement leads to slower spending growth per DAU or even a decline in user spend.- Aging up proves unsuccessful and developer growth no longer supports the metric.- Bookings growth through 2027 grows under \(20\%\) - Our \(\) 75\(PT implies \sim 35x 2026E EBITDA\) \ \(1.4M\)

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Product quality & safety of the platform given the significant underage audience and inherent risk that comes with operating a user- generated content platform (UGC). 2) Business ethics practices, despite being a controlled company. The majority of RBLX's voting shares are held by CEO David Baszucki, potentially creating an imbalance in the decision- making process. 3) Energy management related to hosting \(\sim 58\) MM daily active users, across 27MM+ user- generated experiences that are streamed to the Roblox Client via the cloud.
Company Target(s): RBLX has yet to formally publish an ESG/sustainability report, so there are no specific company targets to mention.

Qs to Mmt: 1) How have your safety and civility policies changed as the platform has grown and aged- up- content is more abundant? 2) How do you ensure that the best interests of all shareholders are being taken into consideration when making business decisions? 3) Will the environmental impact of your data centers or infrastructure providers become a concern as the platform scales?
ESG Deep Dive: Interactive Entertainment
Exhibit 1 - BRLX Income Statement
Source: Company data, Jefferies
Roblox is an online human co- experience platform based on user- generated content built using the Roblox game engine.
Our \(\) 126\(PT implies 45x 2026E EBITDA of\) \ \(1.86B\) . Risks to our PT include a drop- off in engagement and DAUs, inability to age up, and decelerating growth in international markets.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10,\) the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10,\) the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period. NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE, growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise PicksJefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
